DataElement.preferredName: Person Stroke Symptom Assessment Description Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being._A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to hemorrhage or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something._The words of something written.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being._A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to hemorrhage or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

Property.preferredDefinition: A sudden, nonconvulsive loss of neurologic function due to an ischemic or hemorrhagic intracranial vascular event. In general, cerebrovascular accidents are classified by anatomic location in the brain, vascular distribution, etiology, age of the affected individual, and hemorrhagic vs. nonhemorrhagic nature. (From Adams et al., Principles of Neurology, 6th ed, pp777-810):An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to hemorrhage or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ReferenceDocuments.name: A questionnaire to determine
ReferenceDocuments.description: A questionnaire to determine if the respondent has had an ischemic infarction (i.e. stroke) and/or any symptoms related to this event.
